question: How does the Coordination of Benefits (COB) system work with Northwind Standard when you have other health coverage, and what are the exceptions to this process?
truth: The Coordination of Benefits (COB) system with Northwind Standard works by determining which health plan pays first when an employee has more than one health plan. If you have other health coverage, such as Medicare or another employer's health plan, Northwind Standard may still provide coverage in certain circumstances through a process called 'subrogation and reimbursement.' This occurs when another health plan pays for a service that is also covered by Northwind Standard, assuming the service was medically necessary and received from an in-network provider. However, if Northwind Standard pays for a service already covered by your other health plan, you may be responsible for reimbursing Northwind Standard if you do not provide proof of your other coverage. There are exceptions to the COB process, such as services related to emergency care, mental health and substance abuse treatment, or services received from out-of-network providers, where coordination of benefits will not be available.
